used_tips: 💡 Use 'man command' to read the manual for any command
� Forgot sudo? Type 'sudo !!' to re-run your last command with sudo privileges. Game changer!
💡 Press Ctrl+R to search your command history interactively. Start typing and watch the magic happen.
⚡ Use 'cd -' to jump back to your previous directory instantly. No more retyping long paths!
🎯 'Ctrl+A' jumps to the start of a line, 'Ctrl+E' to the end. Your fingers will thank you.
🔥 Made a typo? 'Ctrl+U' clears everything before the cursor. 'Ctrl+K' clears after.
💪 'mkdir -p dir1/dir2/dir3' creates nested directories in one shot. No need for multiple commands.
🎨 'ls -lth' shows files sorted by time (newest first). Add 'head' to see just the latest: ls -lth | head
⏱️ Use 'time {command}' to see exactly how long any command takes. Great for optimization!
🔍 'grep -r "text" .' searches ALL files in current directory recursively. Add '-i' for case-insensitive.
📊 'du -sh *' shows the size of each item in the current directory. Find those space hogs!
🎯 'find . -name "*.log" -mtime +30 -delete' finds and deletes log files older than 30 days.
🚀 'tail -f file.log' watches a file in real-time. Perfect for monitoring logs as they update.
💡 Create an alias: alias gs="git status" in ~/.bashrc and never type the full command again.
⚡ 'history | awk '{print $2}' | sort | uniq -c | sort -rn | head' shows your most-used commands.
🔥 '!$' refers to the last argument of the previous command. Try: mkdir test && cd !$
🎯 'Ctrl+L' clears the screen (same as 'clear' but faster). Keep your terminal tidy!
💪 'df -h' shows disk space in human-readable format. Know when you're running out of space.
🎨 'ps aux | grep process_name' finds running processes. Add '| grep -v grep' to exclude the grep itself.
⏱️ Use '&' at the end to run commands in background: npm run build &
🔍 'which python' shows the full path of a command. Use 'type -a python' to see ALL versions.
💡 'chmod +x script.sh' makes a file executable. Now you can run it with './script.sh'
🚀 'curl wttr.in' gives you the weather forecast in your terminal. Add your city: curl wttr.in/Berlin
⚡ 'cat file.txt | tee output.txt' displays AND saves output simultaneously.
🔥 'xargs' is powerful: find . -name "*.tmp" | xargs rm removes all .tmp files found.
🎯 'rsync -av --progress source/ dest/' syncs directories with a progress bar. Better than cp!
💪 'diff <(ls dir1) <(ls dir2)' compares directory contents using process substitution.
🎨 'watch -n 1 "command"' runs a command every second. Great for monitoring changes.
⏱️ 'nohup command &' runs a process that survives logout. Output goes to nohup.out
